data.question: What is the formula for the coordination polymer formed from the reaction with compound 3?
What type of structure is formed from the reaction with compound 6?
How does the positioning of carboxylic acid functionality affect the assembly of metal-organic structures?
data.answer: An obtuse angle between the acid functionalities and lower-rim centroid leads to a coordination polymer, while a more acute angle results in discrete metal–organic capsule formation.

data.question: Is the formation of the metal-organic capsule and coordination polymer solvent dependent?
What role does 1,10-phenanthroline (phen) play in the assembly of the metal-organic structures?
data.answer: Phenanthroline restricts the coordination sites available around the directing cadmium centres, influencing the resulting structure.

data.question: What is the impact of the cone angles in compound 3 on the formation of the coordination polymer?
data.answer: The partially pinched-cone conformation with specific narrow and wide cone angles facilitates the formation of the 1-D coordination polymer chain.

data.question: Does the discrete metal–organic capsule formed from compound 6 contain any guest molecules within its structure?
What future work is planned for the new metal–organic capsule?
data.answer: Future work will focus on host–guest solution behaviour of the new capsule and the design of new metal–organic frameworks and polyhedra with cavity-containing components.

data.question: How does the coordination polymer formed from compound 3 interact with neighboring chains?
data.answer: The coordination polymer chains interweave through host–guest CH-π interactions between neighboring cavities of compound 3 and ligated phenanthrolines.

data.question: Is the formation of the coordination polymer and metal-organic capsule influenced by the symmetry of the calixarene used?
What is the yield of the pale yellow solid obtained from the synthesis of p-di-carboxylato-di-O-butoxy-di-O-bis(p-nitrobenezenesulfonyloxy)-calix[4]arene?
What is the role of sodium hydride in the synthesis of Di-O-butoxy-di-O-bis(p-nitrobenezenesulfonyloxy)-calix[4]arene?
data.answer: Sodium hydride is added to the mixture and stirred at 0°C for 30 minutes, likely serving as a base to deprotonate the compound and facilitate the subsequent reaction step.

data.question: Does the synthesis of p-di-carboxylato-di-O-butoxy-calix[4]arene involve the use of potassium hydroxide?
What is the melting point range for the compound synthesized from Compound 1 after the addition of p-Nitrobenzene sulfonyl chloride?
What is the significance of the angles measured in the partially pinched-cone conformers observed in the coordination polymer and metal-organic capsule?
data.answer: The angles measured in the partially pinched-cone conformers indicate how the calixarene's conformation influences the assembly and structure of the resulting metal-organic frameworks or capsules.

data.question: Is the yield of the pale yellow solid formed in the synthesis of p-di-formyl-di-O-butoxy-di-O-bis(p-nitrobenezenesulfonyloxy)-calix[4]arene higher than 70%?
What is the role of hexamethylenetetramine in the synthesis of p-di-formyl-di-O-butoxy-di-O-bis(p-nitrobenezenesulfonyloxy)-calix[4]arene?
data.answer: Hexamethylenetetramine is stirred together with compound 4 and trifluoroacetic acid at 90°C for 24 hours, likely acting as a reagent in the formylation process.

data.question: How does the presence of dmf and water as ligands and guests influence the structure of the metal-organic capsule formed from compound 6?
data.answer: The presence of dmf and water as ligands and guests influences the coordination chemistry around the cadmium centers and the overall distortion and occupancy within the capsule's structure.

data.question: Is the synthesis of Di-O-butoxy-di-O-bis(p-nitrobenezenesulfonyloxy)-calix[4]arene carried out under a nitrogen atmosphere?
What is the role of methanol in the purification process of the synthesized compounds?
data.answer: Methanol is added to the reaction mixture, resulting in a precipitate that is filtered and washed with methanol to purify the synthesized compounds.
